question: [File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/das/unweighted_protocol.rs] [Function: decrypt_own_share()] [Wrapper type safety] Do the DealtSecretKeyShare and DealtPubKeyShare wrappers at lines 276-277 perform validation, or can invalid keys be created? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/das/unweighted_protocol.rs] [Function: decrypt_own_share()] [Concurrent decryption] If multiple players decrypt simultaneously, can race conditions in accessing self.C and self.V cause corrupted shares? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/das/unweighted_protocol.rs] [Function: decrypt_own_share()] [Player ID validation] Is player.id checked to be < sc.n before array access, or can out-of-range IDs cause crashes? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/das/unweighted_protocol.rs] [Function: aggregate_with()] [Size mismatch] Can aggregating transcripts with different sizes (self.C.len() != other.C.len()) at line 333 cause partial aggregation and state corruption? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/das/unweighted_protocol.rs] [Function: aggregate_with()] [Randomness aggregation] Does adding hat_w values at line 320 properly combine ElGamal randomness, or can this leak information about individual randomness values? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/das/unweighted_protocol.rs] [Function: aggregate_with()] [Ciphertext homomorphism] Can the ciphertext addition at line 324 be exploited to create invalid aggregated ciphertexts that pass verification? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/das/unweighted_protocol.rs] [Function: aggregate_with()] [Commitment aggregation attack] Can the V[i] additions at line 325 be manipulated to create commitments that don't correspond to the aggregated polynomial? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/das/unweighted_protocol.rs] [Function: aggregate_with()] [Public key aggregation] Does the aggregation of V[sc.n] at line 327 properly compute the combined public key, or can malicious contributions corrupt it? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/das/unweighted_protocol.rs] [Function: aggregate_with()] [SoK vector poisoning] Can pushing cloned SoKs at line 330 introduce duplicate or conflicting dealer signatures that bypass verification? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/das/unweighted_protocol.rs] [Function: aggregate_with()] [Debug assertion bypass] Are the debug_assert_eq! checks at lines 333-334 enforced in production, or can size mismatches occur in release builds? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/das/unweighted_protocol.rs] [Function: aggregate_with()] [Integer overflow] Can the loop at line 323 cause integer overflow if sc.n is extremely large, leading to incorrect aggregation? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/das/unweighted_protocol.rs] [Function: aggregate_with()] [Atomic aggregation] Is aggregation atomic, or can partial aggregation leave the transcript in an invalid state if an error occurs mid-operation? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/das/unweighted_protocol.rs] [Function: aggregate_with()] [Group operation safety] Do the += operations on G1Projective and G2Projective at lines 320-327 handle edge cases like identity elements correctly? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/das/unweighted_protocol.rs] [Function: aggregate_with()] [Dealer deduplication] Does the function check for duplicate dealers before pushing SoKs, or can the same dealer contribute multiple times? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/das/unweighted_protocol.rs] [Function: maul_signature()] [Signature replacement attack] Can replacing soks[0] at lines 349-351 allow an attacker to impersonate the original dealer after aggregation? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/das/unweighted_protocol.rs] [Function: maul_signature()] [Index bounds] Does accessing soks[0] at line 349 check if soks is empty, or can this cause panic with no signatures? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/das/unweighted_protocol.rs] [Function: maul_signature()] [Player ID forgery] Can modifying soks[0].0 to an arbitrary player at line 349 allow dealer impersonation in aggregated transcripts? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/das/unweighted_protocol.rs] [Function: maul_signature()] [Commitment consistency] Does changing the commitment at line 350 maintain consistency with V.last(), or can desynchronization occur? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/das/unweighted_protocol.rs] [Function: maul_signature()] [Signature validity] Is the new signature at line 348 validated to be correct before replacement, or can invalid signatures be injected? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/das/unweighted_protocol.rs] [Function: maul_signature()] [Malleability purpose] Can this function be abused to re-sign transcripts with different auxiliary data to bypass downstream validation? (Medium)
